data.title: Variety, docus, daytime wrap DGA TV nominees
data.meta_description: The Directors Guild of America announced the last of its nominees for achievement in television directing Friday. Winners will be announced Saturday at the BevHilton.
data.text:
The Directors Guild of America announced the last of its nominees for achievement in television directing Friday. Winners will be announced Saturday at the BevHilton.

A list of the remaining nominees follows:

MUSICAL VARIETY

Hal Gurnee –“Late Night 10th Anniversary Special” ; associate directors, Peter Fatovich, Brian McAloon; stage managers, Jeff Samaha, Biff Henderson. (NBC)

Jeff Margolis –“65th Annual Academy Awards”; associate directors, Wendy Acey , Debbie Palacio, Marilyn Seabury; stage managers, Dave Wader, Dency Nelson, Peter Margolis, Steve Burgess, Debbie Williams; production associates, Julie Miller, Paula Shugart (ABC).

Bobby Quinn –“The Tonight Show,” Carson Prods.; associate director, Jim Kantrowe; stage managers, Kevin Quinn, Michael Grey; production associate, Leslie Crawford (NBC).

DOCUMENTARIES

Ric Burns –“The Donner Party.”

Joe Berlinger — Bruce Sinofsky, “Brother’s Keeper.”

Mark Stouffer –“Braving Alaska.”

DAYTIME DRAMA

Neema Barnette –“Different Worlds,” Citadel Entertainment; unit production manager/first assistant director, Dale R. White; second assistant director, Jeff Rafner; production assistant, Bonita Brisker (CBS).

Strath Hamilton –“Please God, I’m Only 17,” Churchill Films; unit production manager/first assistant director, Leslie Waldman; second assistant director, Simon Barron (CBS).

Helaine Head –“You Must Remember This,” Wonderworks (PBS)

DRAMATIC SPECIALS

Joseph Sargent –“Miss Rose White,” Marian Rees Associates; unit prod’n manager, Carl Clifford; first asst. director, Nick Mastandrea; second asst. director, Rosemary Cremona; production asst., Sherry Miller (NBC).

Ron J. Lagomarsino –“Picket Fences” (pilot), David E. Kelley Prods; unit production manager, Ron Mitchell; first assistant director, Jack Philbrick; second assistant director, John Isabeau; technical coordinator, Donna Short; production associate, Charlie Montoya (CBS).

Frank Pierson –“Citizen Cohn,” Spring Creek Prods; unit production manager, Daniel Schneider; first assistant director, Matthew Carlisle.
